title: Web Engineer - Javascript, NodeJS, React
description: Deliver features for end-to-end web application development on a multi-functional team Learn how to build applications using our in-house frameworks Collaborate with product owners to understand business needs and participate in refining stories Embrace code review, pair programming, and process innovation to better yourself and the team Optimize code for accessibility, performance, availability Increase the confidence in our deployments by writing tests, contributing to reliability frameworks, and finding automation opportunities Investigate and resolve production issues with the help of our site reliability team Innovate and implement new technologies in an effort to improve our team and applications Have at least 3 years of experience in Web Development Have solid experience with front end frameworks and state management with or similar to React.js / Redux Have a strong understanding of NodeJS, Jest, Mocha, Rest, GraphQL, Express Have experience with modern JavaScript coding, open source ecosystem, and development practices Have a passion for providing the best customer experience, and is comfortable optimizing for accessibility and performance Are comfortable working in an environment based on Agile development methodologies and DevOps principles Take initiative to mentor engineers, and collaborate with others in order to find solutions to the team's problems Are excited about innovation and automation Want to join a team that is always trying to improve and grow!Booster eligibility: The CDC has established guidelines for when adults are eligible to receive booster shots depending on when they completed their initial vaccine series (currently five months after the Pfizer-BioNTech and Moderna vaccines, and two months after the J&J Vaccine). If you have completed your primary vaccine series but have not yet reached your booster eligibility date, you will be able to come into the office; however, you will need to complete your booster within 30 days of becoming eligible to continue coming in and participating in company-sponsored in-person events.

title: React Engineer
description: You will work with engineering, QA, and product management to provide customer experiences that strengthen the Stadium Goods brand for our customers, sellers, and other partnersYou will take part in the monitoring of production applicationsYou will produce high quality, secure, performant, and tested TypeScript codeYou will contribute to and promote the SG design systemYou will raise the level of your team's code through code reviews and pair programmingYou will improve patterns and practices in use across SG web applicationsYou have at least 4 years of experience developing React powered web applicationsYou have knowledge of mobile best practices and stay informed about developments in the mobile industryYou have a strong understanding of UX/UI concepts and a record of delivering usable softwareYou have experience with at least one commonly used state management library like Relay, Apollo, Redux, etc.You are familiar with Ruby On Rails and able to operate in that environmentYou can perform in a team environment using agile methodologiesYou are a professional with strong problem solving and troubleshooting skillsInterest in eCommerce, sneakers, and streetwear is a plusExperience with atomic design is a plusExperience with graphql is a plusComprehensive total rewards package that includes a great compensation package, company equity, health benefits and 401kPaid time offDynamic career growth opportunitiesA fun, creative and mission-driven work environmentTeam outings and afterwork eventsStadium Goods is committed to being an inclusive workplace where diversity in all its forms is celebrated. We make employment decisions without regard to race, religious creed, color, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, ancestry, marital status, medical condition as defined by state law, physical or mental disability, military service or veteran status, pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions, genetic information or any other classification protected by applicable federal, state or local laws or ordinances. If you require special accommodation, please let us know.

title: Software Engineer - Front End
description: OVERVIEWWhat is Yammer?Microsoft Yammer is the industry-defining social network for the enterprise. Millions of employees, including 85% of Fortune 500 companies use Yammer every day, to build community and culture, share knowledge, and connect with their leaders and each other.Why Yammer?Yammer was one of the first startup unicorns this past decade and was acquired by Microsoft in 2012. Today, this means we get the benefits of a startup - rapid innovation, cutting-edge technology, outsized individual impact - with the advantages of working for one of the most successful software companies in the world. We work together in small, cross-functional teams - engineers, product managers, designers, data scientists - to design, deliver and operate delightful end user experiences to our tens of millions of users spread across the world.We’ve always been mission-driven; In this post-Covid world, Yammer has become even more indispensable than ever as employees have a deep need for connection and a sense of belonging. We’ve been growing rapidly and need your help to take Yammer to the next level.You will have:Autonomy and freedom to innovateChoice of the best of open source and Microsoft-internal technologyThe ability to experiment, A/B test, and make data-driven decisionsTons of opportunity for outsized impact as part of a small but mighty team on a rapidly growing product needed now more than everAt the same time, you also have the benefits of working at a top-tier tech company like Microsoft:Compensation, benefits, and perksInternal resources, technology, and opportunities for learning and growthBrand and networkingOpportunity for massive scale as part of a suite with hundreds of millions of usersAbout this jobYammer is an enterprise product with a best-in class consumer experience. Our tens of millions of users expect a cutting-edge, beautiful UX that seamlessly adapts to various apps and form factors. As a Front-End engineer, you will develop innovative new features and experiences, run experiments to learn and improve the product, and add core capabilities to our web platform with an eye to performance and accessibility. We are looking for someone who is passionate about delighting users, have an eye for craftsmanship and an opinion about what makes a great user experience.Our FE stack:React + Redux (in Typescript)GraphQLAzure Cloud ServicesRESPONSIBILITIESDevelop user-facing features and experiences in partnership with design, product, and engineering.Build reusable code and libraries for maintainability and future use.Build responsive, accessible and localized experiences for a diverse user-base.Experiment, A/B test key hypothesis to make data driven decisions.Optimize for best performance and scalability.QUALIFICATIONS2+ years engineering experience building modern web applications.Strong JavaScript skills.Good understanding of modern web tech stack; we use TypeScript, React, Redux, Webpack, Jest, and GraphQL.Good expertise in web markup including CSS3, HTML5.Good troubleshooting and performance tuning skills.Good understanding of best practices of building cross browser and device independent interfaces.Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or equivalent.Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.#Yammer

description: Serving as a core member of an agile team that leads user story analysis and elaboration, designs and develops software applications Responsible for the applications architecture, work/coordinate with other team’s architect, engineers and vendors as necessary Writing code and unit tests, automation, and conducting code reviews and testing Identifying exciting opportunities for adopting new technologies to solve existing needs and predicting future challenges Performing ongoing refactoring of code, utilizing visualization and other techniques to fast track concepts, and delivering continuous improvement Working with product managers to prioritize features for ongoing sprints and managing a list of technical requirements based on industry trends, new technologies, known defects, and issues Manage your own time, and work well both independently and as part of a team Quickly generate and updating proof of concepts for testing and team feedback Embrace emerging standards while promoting best practicesMust have experience in using Version Controls like Git and Tools like Jira forth Agile methodologies. Experience with React, JavaScript Frameworks, HTML5, CSS3 Experience with REACT/Redux preferred Expertise with using RESTful APIs Expertise in objected oriented analysis and design across a variety of platforms Understanding of web performance optimization techniques. Thorough understanding of JSON, Web Service technologies, and data structure fundamentals Experience with adaptive and responsive development techniques Aptitude for learning and applying programming concepts  Excellent time management, multi-tasking, and organizational skills Ability to effectively communicate with internal and external business partners Experience with a broad range of software languages and payments technologies is a plus.Booster eligibility: The CDC has established guidelines for when adults are eligible to receive booster shots depending on when they completed their initial vaccine series (currently five months after the Pfizer-BioNTech and Moderna vaccines, and two months after the J&J Vaccine). If you have completed your primary vaccine series but have not yet reached your booster eligibility date, you will be able to come into the office; however, you will need to complete your booster within 30 days of becoming eligible to continue coming in and participating in company-sponsored in-person events.

title: Front-End Software Engineer – Remote
description: Assist in updating, maintaining, and implementing new features for the MSN Games site (https://zone.msn.com/), as well as other partner channels.Assist in developing implementation plans for new experiences, according to functional requirements and feature specifications.Consult on a regular basis with project leadership to align expectations and deliverables.Collaborate with designers, artists, and other software engineers to deliver new experiences, tools, and features.Document code for portability and future development.Fluidly multitask between features, platforms, and projects.4+ years experience in software development for the web.Strong background in modern JavaScript development.Familiarity with typescript.Familiarity with common web development frameworks, particularly Angular.A passion for games and gaming, specifically casual games.Strongly motivated and excited by working on a small nimble team, with the ability to work both independently and in collaboration with other team members.BS in Computer Science or similar alternative educational paths, or equivalent experience. We are a fully remote studio with team members all over the United States. You can move to Redmond if you’d like to work with some of the team in the office, but it’s entirely up to you.Experience interacting with external APIs and web services.Experience building customer-facing web apps.Experience deploying and managing web-based applications with Azure.Experience with Azure DevOps.Experience with HTML5 games and common web game frameworks, particularly Phaser.

title: Front End Engineer and Designer
description: You will work collaboratively with User Experience, Product Management and Engineering team members to develop web and mobile interfaces for Aruba/HPE's market-leading productsYou will brainstorm, design, prototype and develop user interfaces including interactive data visualizations using cutting edge application frameworksYou will communicate product architectures, design proposals, and negotiate options with stakeholdersYou will interact with users to define system requirements and iterate design improvementsYou are experienced with programming languages like React, Angular or similar frameworksYou are proficient in HTML, CSS and JavaScriptYou are familiar with UI and Usability design principles, conceptual design and prototypingYou are experienced with data visualization techniques and toolsYou hold a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or equivalent experienceYou have 2+ years of experience in front-end software development with an emphasis on UI, UX design

title: Front-end Software Engineer
description: Build features from start to finish. Start with research or an idea, work with design to draft up a spec, build, launch, and polish. Improve and iterate on existing features through A/B testing, user, or team feedback. Build and improve existing internal tools, helping us maintain our team's high impact on our growing community. Play an active role in the shaping of the future of the product and business.You love problem-solving — especially with code. You’re looking for your first full-time software role and have the ambition and skills to grow quickly as an engineer. You’re a more experienced engineer looking to use your skills to own and build a product that’s changing people’s lives. You’ve had experience working in a small team to deliver a product experiencing rapid growth. You know how to balance building quickly with building well. You have experience with some or all of the following: HTML/CSS/Javascript React/Redux TypescriptHealth, dental, and vision insurance (if US-based). New laptop/equipment to suit your needs. Flexible vacation time. Hybrid remote/office work culture.

title: Senior Front End Engineer
description: HODINKEE is a fast-growing media brand and shop that makes watches accessible to everyone. Over the past decade, founder Ben Clymer has grown HODINKEE into a thriving company of creatives. Our team now consists of writers, editors, designers, photographers, podcasters, engineers, and so many other key players who cement HODINKEE’s position as the most trusted source for watch news and products. We have a website. An app. A podcast. A magazine. A retail business. And more. HODINKEE’s goal is to bring readers and consumers the best in wristwatches in a way that’s approachable, authentic, honest and fun.What You Will DoHODINKEE is looking for a full-time Front-End Engineer to help build the top platform for everything watch related. We are the combination of an editorial outlet, an e-commerce/retail platform, and a tech-forward product team. As a Front-End Engineer at HODINKEE, your work will touch most of the business and enable technology to keep the experience for our readers and customers on the bleeding edge.From an engineering standpoint, you will need to be able to implement new features, as well as understand, work with, and refactor existing code. We are looking for someone that can solve problems efficiently and cleanly. We are a fast growing team, so we need someone that is flexible and can help review the work of the other developers.Who You AreAt a minimum, candidates should have at least 5 years of experience in the following:Extensive JavaScript experience, including knowledge of modern tooling (like babel.js + webpack) and development techniques.Expert knowledge of React and its ecosystem.Strong proficiency with modern HTML and CSS/SCSS.Experience interfacing with API’s, both in-house and 3rd party.Ability to implement responsive designs and work closely with our designers. You won’t be responsible for creating your own designs, but should have enough of a design sense to offer feedback and tweaks during implementation.Proficiency working with git version control.Candidates must possess authorization to work in the U.S.An exceptional candidate will have some additional, preferred qualities such as:Experience working with GraphQL.Experience working with Shopify or any other e-commerce platform.Experience working with Ruby/Rails.Experience working with languages other than JavaScript that could bring value to our platform, e.g. TypeScript.Experience working on content management systems or parts thereof, e.g. WYSIWYG editors.Familiarity with SVG’s and animation on the web (either CSS or JS based).Passionate about performance optimization, either at a language or a system level.An interest in watches or other collectibles!HODINKEE is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. We’re committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace and strongly encourage applicants from all backgrounds and walks of life.
